oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Why Danish Organic Farming Policy has been Successful
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Daugbjerg, Carsten
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Policy environments and social economy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Danish organic farming policy has proved successful in growing the market for organic food. This article outlines the architecture of the policy and explains why, unlike elsewhere, it has put considerable emphasis on demand creating measures. Finally, the conditions under which the Danish model can be transferred to other countries are discussed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Daugbjerg, Carsten (2010) Why Danish Organic Farming Policy has been Successful. ICROFS News, 1 August 2010, pp. 3-4.
